subject: statistics
title: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test
contentHtml:
The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is a nonparametric statistical test used to compare two groups based on their ranks rather than their actual values.

This test is particularly useful when the data doesn't meet the assumptions of parametric tests, such as normality or equal variances.
name: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Statistic" },
problemHtml:
Suppose we want to compare the ranks of exam scores between two groups: students who studied for an extra hour and those who didn't. We have the following data:

  • Group A (studied): 12, 15, 20, 22, 25
  • Group B (didn't study): 10, 11, 14, 18, 21
finalAnswer: Reject the null hypothesis if W is significant" },
intuition: The Wilcoxon rank-sum test helps us determine whether there's a statistically significant difference between two groups based on their ranks, rather than their actual values.
realWorldApplications: Comparing user engagement metrics in A/B testing

subject: statistics
title: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test
contentHtml:
The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is a nonparametric statistical test used to compare two groups based on their rankings rather than their actual values.

  • It's particularly useful when the data doesn't meet the assumptions of parametric tests, such as normality or equal variances.
name: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Statistic" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to compare the average ranking of two groups of students based on their exam scores.

steps.description: Rank the scores in each group from lowest to highest
steps.explanation: This helps us focus on the relative positions rather than the actual values.

intuition: The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is a powerful tool for comparing groups without assuming normality or equal variances.
realWorldApplications: Comparing the performance of two machine learning models on a dataset

subject: statistics
title: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test
contentHtml:
The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is a nonparametric statistical test used to compare two groups based on their ranks rather than actual values.

This test is particularly useful when the data is not normally distributed or when there are outliers in the data.
name: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Statistic" },
problemHtml:
Suppose we want to compare the ranks of exam scores between two groups: students who received extra tutoring and those who did not. We have the following data:

  • Tutoring group: 3, 5, 7, 9
  • No tutoring group: 1, 2, 4, 6
description: Calculate the sum of ranks for each group
explanation: This step is where we apply the Wilcoxon rank-sum statistic formula" } ],
finalAnswer: The answer will depend on the actual data and the p-value calculated from the test" },
intuition: The Wilcoxon rank-sum test helps us to identify if there's a significant difference between two groups based on their ranks, which can be more robust than comparing means or medians

subject: statistics
title: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test
contentHtml: The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is a nonparametric statistical test used to compare two groups based on their ranks rather than actual values.
name: Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Statistic" },
problemHtml: Compare the ranks of exam scores between two classes.

steps.description: Rank the scores in both groups
steps.explanation: This helps to reduce the impact of outliers.

intuition: The Wilcoxon rank-sum test is useful when the data doesn't meet the assumptions of a parametric test, such as normality or equal variances.
realWorldApplications: Comparing user engagement metrics between different marketing campaigns
